unhappy.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: If you’re so unhappy, why don’t you change jobs?
unhappy.translation[0].definitions[0].no: In everyday English, people often say they feel down or fed up rather than unhappy:
The situation at home was making her feel very down.
unhappy.translation[0].definitions[1].de: feeling worried or annoyed because you do not like what is happening in a particular situation
unhappy.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Dennis is unhappy about having to work on a Saturday.
We were all unhappy with the quality of the service.
unhappy.translation[0].definitions[2].de: an unhappy remark, situation etc is not suitable, lucky, or desirable
unhappy.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: After a while I didn’t feel quite so unhappy.
Both his parents looked very unhappy.
Did Bill seem unhappy to you?
The Government was deeply unhappy about criticism from the press.
It was the first time she had been away from home and she was desperately unhappy.
Stevens had a unhappy childhood in Manchester.
Her parents had had an unhappy marriage.
Ruth tried to put these unhappy memories from her mind.
